alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 2:56AM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. In addition, dangerous wind chills of 20 to 30 below zero are occurring. * WHERE...Marias Pass, Bad Rock Canyon, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Essex, and Polebridge. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Although snow has largely ended, difficult travel will continue due to blowing and drifting snow. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
